data:
Emil 
		P 
		Kartalov Phone: (831) 656-2125 epkartal@nps.edu https://my.nps.edu/web/physics/nps-physics-research-kartalov Overview Grew up in Bulgaria, Europe. Came to the US in 1994 to be freshman at Caltech. Caltech BS Physics 1998, MS Applied Physics 2004, PhD Applied Physics 2004. Green card in 1998 through Diversity Visa Program. US Citizen since 2004. Postdoc at USC 2004-2008. Faculty at USC 2008-2016. Faculty at NPS since May 2016. Married since 2010. One son born 2011. 23 peer-reviewed papers published. 18 US patents issued. micro fabrication, nanotechnology, and microfluidics for novel materials, biochips, biosensing, nuclear safety and forensics; novel weapons systems electromagnetism, mechanics, microfluidics, microfabrication, optics, fluorescence microscopy, nanotechnology 2012 - 
			Baxter Family Foundation Award, Baxter Family Foundation 2011 - 
			NASA TechBriefs Innovation Award, NASA 2008 - 
			NIH R00 Career Award, NIH 2006 - 
			NIH K99 Career Award , NIH
